TextDecoderFatal.summary: The fatal read-only property of the interface is a {{jsxref('Boolean')}} indicating whether the error mode is fatal.

remarks.para:
If the property is true, then a decoder will throw a if it encounters malformed data while decoding.
If false, the decoder will substitute the invalid data with the replacement character U+FFFD (ï¿½).
The value of the property is set in the TextDecoder() constructor.

TextDecoderFatal.value:
A boolean which will be true if the error mode is set to fatal.
Otherwise, it will be false, indicating that the error mode is replacement.
